story:
Here's that resume rewritten as a story:

From Penn State's hallways to the corporate world, this is the story of a driven professional who has consistently excelled in relationship management and sales. Our protagonist began their journey at Penn State's SMEAL College of Business, where they not only maintained an impressive 3.5 GPA but also demonstrated leadership as the captain of the women's soccer team.

Fresh out of college in 2010, they cut their teeth in real estate as a Sales and Marketing Assistant, learning the ropes of client relations while creating marketing materials and handling open house showings. This foundation in direct customer interaction would prove invaluable in their career trajectory.

The next chapter brought them to Braskem as a Senior Sales Coordinator, where they managed relationships with 20 polypropylene accounts. Their analytical mindset shone through when they developed a bi-monthly account analysis model so impressive that it was adopted company-wide. They were even hand-picked by upper management to handle the company's most prestigious "Strategic National Accounts."

In 2012, they took on a new challenge at Cars.com as a Digital Media Sales Representative. Here, they truly found their stride, managing 60 unique clients and achieving the remarkable feat of exceeding their 2013 sales goal by 228%. Their crowning achievement? Negotiating the largest individual sale in Cars.com Philadelphia's history.

Since 2014, they've been writing their latest chapter at Josten's as a Sales Representative, where they manage over 40 clients and $700,000 in account volume. They've doubled new account growth year-over-year and continue to make their mark by implementing educational programs and fostering school pride.

Throughout this journey, they've maintained a commitment to technological proficiency, mastering everything from Salesforce to Adobe Creative Suite, while building a reputation as a trusted advisor and relationship manager who consistently exceeds expectations.
